EmailTemplate.subject: eWeekly – Elavon Changes Effective Immediately
EmailTemplate.textOnly: January 21, 2021 Immediate Changes for NCR Aloha Customers Using Elavon On Thursday, January 21, 2021, Elavon is transitioning to a more secure digital certificate, PRODGATE02.VIACONEX.COM, in their production environment to process payment transactions using the Entrust certificate. NCR successfully deployed a script to make the changes automatically for customers that are using Elavon for their payment services. However, we recommend that customers validate the changes were applied to their environment by following these instructions <[[https://ncr.quickbase.com/up/bqe6gx23b/g/rcj/ek/va/Instructions to Check the EDC Site.pdf]]>. If customers have any questions, contact NCR Customer Support. BSP Gateway Cutover from NCR Enterprise Platform (NEP) to Apigee As part of our continuing initiatives to expand and improve the NCR Business Services Platform, NCR will switch Gateway traffic to route through Apigee on Tuesday, February 2, 2021 between 1:00 and 4:00 AM ET. Clients using the NCR Business Services Platform (BSP) will be impacted by this change if their firewall is leveraging IP-based firewall management rules. Please read the announcement <[[https://ncr.quickbase.com/up/bqe6gx23b/g/rcf/ek/va/BSP Gateway Cutover from NEP to Apigee happening February 2 FINAL.pdf]]> for additional details and ensure your customers to take action by January 29, 2021 to avoid any connectivity loss that may negatively impact their business. Decommission of NCR Dallas Data Center for NCR Mobile Pay Only NCR plans to permanently decommission our Dallas Data Center for NCR Mobile Pay only. NCR Mobile Pay clients utilizing the Dallas (DFW05) Data Center must whitelist their NCR endpoints before the designated migration dates or they will be at risk of losing access to their licensed NCR Mobile Pay products that are hosted in the Dallas Data Center.
